abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column notes younger players appear to be gaining on longtime champions Venus and Serena Williams; points out nineteen-year-old Madison Keys prepares to play Venus, her childhood idol, in Australian Open quarterfinals.
lead_paragraph: Madison Keys was 4 when she started swinging a racket after seeing Venus Williams on TV. Now 19, she will face Williams, 34, for the first time in a Grand Slam tournament.
snippet: Madison Keys was 4 when she started swinging a racket after seeing Venus Williams on TV. Now 19, she will face Williams, 34, for the first time in a Grand Slam tournament.

headline.main: On a Big Stage, Hoping to Beat Her Inspiration
headline.seo: Madison Keys to Face Venus Williams in Australian Open Quarterfinal
headline.print_headline: On a Big Stage, Hoping to Beat Her Inspiration
